result.execSummary:
The defendant Kaitlin Marie Snoddy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kaitlin Marie Snoddy is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kaitlin Marie Snoddy was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for Probation on 07/13/22 by 11:00 AM.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kaitlin Marie Snoddy

records.addlTxt: to reset and appear via zoom, filed by DE.   Per EFV 10/12/20222: Approved. JA provided zoom info to DE. olg
e: DA, Atty Petersen, and DOC. c: DE and Hudson PD.  Email: Jail
Filed by Atty Petersen. arc    c:DE

9:32 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Melissa M. Petersen in court for Kaitlin Marie Snoddy. Defendant Kaitlin Marie Snoddy in court. Includes 22CF408 and 22TR1805.Court reviews case. ADA Ellenwood recites resolution. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads No Contest in case 22CF408 Count 2: Possession of Cocaine/Coca- 961.41(3g)(c). Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses 22CF408 Count 1 & 3, and Case 22TR1805. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders:

Count 2: S/W 1 Year Probation

- 90 days condition time STAYED
- Court Costs: $243.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- DNA Surcharge: $200.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- DNA Sample 
- AODA/ Rule 25 within 30 Days and follow through with recommendations
- Psychological evaluation within 30 days and follow through with recommendations- if requested by Agent
- Mental Health  Exam and follow through with recommendations
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Prescribed medications only as prescribed
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation on 07/13/22 by 11:00 AM 


Adjourned at 09:52 AM
Probation review hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
Probation review hearing on October 13, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

9:10 AM Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kaitlin Marie Snoddy appeared by video.  Attorney Melissa M. Petersen in court for Kaitlin Marie Snoddy. Includes 22CF408 and 22TR1805.  Court reviews file. Atty Petersen states prelim not needed and resolution has been reached. Atty Petersen waives time limits on prelim and requests to set plea date. Court advises Defendant of right to speedy preliminary hearing. Defendant understands. Court finds DE freely and voluntarily waives right to speedy preliminary hearing. Court sets Plea/Sentencing Hearing in person, but will allow Zoom appearances if not resolved. DE confirms address and phone number. Adjourned at 9:15 AM.  gll
